revised_title: Infra-Red Emission and Absorption in Mercury: Temperature and Vapour-Pressure Effects
tldr: This article investigates the emission and absorption of infra-red light in mercury vapour. The authors study the effects of temperature and vapour-pressure on the relative intensities of specific lines in the spectrum. They also explore the absorption bands produced by passing white light through non-luminous mercury vapour. The findings contribute to the understanding of atomic physics and spectroscopy, particularly in the context of mercury.
